title: Hues of the Fall
lyrics:
And we stand naked and deep
In another place
And you fall into me
Underneath the weight
And you call me oblique
As if you never needed someone

And you fall into me



So nod your eyes, ooh

So nod your eyes, mmh



You'll be happy

If I ever walk the line

Baby you'll see

Catching pieces

Faded in the stars of me

And wake me up

I don't ever wanna wake up anymore

Oh-oh, oh



Face down in the water

I called you again

As if I was younger

And everything I ever thought

Was true when grown

As if you didn't know that

That you called me oblique

Thicker than water

And you call out to me



So nod your eyes, ooh

So nod your eyes



You'll be happy

If I ever walk the line

Baby you'll see

Catching pieces

Faded in the stars of me

And wake me up

I don't ever wanna wake up anymore

No, oh

No, no



I don't wanna wake up, start anew

I just wanna wake up, start anew

I don't wanna wake up, start anew

I just wanna wake up



And this moment with point of view

The light just beaming around you in the cold

You know my heart will come back to you

And flow right back with all the hues of the fall

You're a perennial, mmh
